Quick search

Welcome to Data TSA’s documentation!¶

The Profiler class is the main interface for Data TSA:

class data_tsa.profiler.Profiler(dataframe, slicer=None)¶
get_column_dtype(column)¶

Returns the simple type of the provided column.

Parameters

column (str) – column name

Returns

‘string’, ‘number’, or ‘datetime’ ValueError if simple type not detected

get_slicer_values()¶

Returns a sorted list of unique slicer values.

get_type_exception(column)¶

Checks to see if a given column has a user-specified exception type.

Parameters

column (str) – column name

Returns

‘string’, ‘number’, ‘datetime’, or None

insp_dict_to_dataframe(column, inspection_dict)¶

Tranforms and inspection dictionary into a pandas.DataFrame.

profile(lags=None)¶

Performs a column-wise evaluation of the columns in the dataframe.

Parameters

lags (int) – The number of lagging measure values to be added to the output table

Returns

A dataframe containing summary measures for each column.

Return type

dataframe

profile_dataframe(dataframe, slice_value)¶

Profiles an individual DataFrame, usually a sliced partition.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – A pandas.DataFrame

  • slice_value (str) – The slicer value for a given partition.

Returns:

set_type_exception(column, dtype)¶

Specify custom target inspection types

Parameters

  • column (str) – column name

  • dtype (str) – ‘string’, ‘number’, or ‘datetime’

validate_column(column)¶

Verifies that a column exists in the provided DataFrame.

Parameters

column (str) – column name

Returns

True if column exists in DataFrame, else False
